A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Visually beautiful and exciting with great combat sequences.  Anyone involved in writing the script or directing should be taken to Jakku\, have their memory wiped and handed over to a junk dealer.  Instead of one or two big plot twists\, there were dozens cases of the director setting up one thing and then doing something else\, leaving the audience frustrated.  A huge amount of time was devoted to sequences that didn't matter to the outcome\, while major questions were ignored or brushed off in a way that disappointed.    All that we learned about Jedi in the previous 7 movies was thrown out the window by the renegade Disney writing team.  The Star Wars franchise was left in wreckage by this movie.
